intro: Humboltia serrifera, commonly known as the serrated humboldtia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, serrated leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Humboltia serrifera is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
